intro: Sarcostemma campanulatum, commonly known as the bell-shaped milkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in summer. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its stems are slender and can be somewhat woody, with milky sap that is a notable feature. Sarcostemma campanulatum is often found in dry, rocky areas and is native to parts of southern Africa.
